titleStmt.title: A speech made by Sergeant Wild in the honourable House of Commons, in the cause of Mercurius Britanicus As it was also (the next day) delivered from his own mouth in a boate, as he past between the temple staires, and Westminster Bridge, heretofore call'd Kings Bridge.
titleStmt.author: Wilde, John, 1590-1669.

notesStmt.note: Place of publication from Wing (CD-ROM edition).
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
